intro: Sidalcea oregana var. procera, commonly known as the tall checkerberry, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its leaves are compound, with multiple small leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. This variety is distinguished by its taller stature compared to other forms of Sidalcea oregana.
